_header: The mind of Thy sweet passion Jesu tears it tells
Note:
For a variant, see 3235, and cf. Woolf (1968)
XWoolf, Rosemary. The English Religious Lyric in the Middle Ages. Oxford: Clarendon, 1968, 373.
_description: Effects of Passion Longing — 1 x 2 in Latin homily, ‘Amore Langueo’

OxfBal149.Transcription:
Þe mynde of þy swet passion Iesu teres it tellesEne it
                    bolleȝ my vesage it wetes & my hert it swetes

OxfMagd93.Transcription:
the mynde of the swete passion teres hit tyllesyene hit bolles
                    my vysage hit wetes and my herte filleth yn swetnesse
OxfMagd93.Note:
Written as two lines, ending ‘tylles’ and
                    ‘swetnesse’.

OxfStJohn190.Transcription:
Þe munde of Cristes passionþat was hure alre
                    ransunteres hit tollezeches hit bolleznebbes hit wetezand
                    hertes hit swetes

CULKk424.Transcription:
The mynde of þy swete passyon ihesuterys hyt tellysmyn eyes
                    hyt bollythmy vesage hyt wetyth& myn herte swetyth

CamGon408.Transcription:
teres tolleteyne bolletloeres wetetand herte
                    swetet
